oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Pelham Colored School
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Pelham Colored School, the last black school in Grundy County. Shows students and teachers in front of the school.

Identified as Mrs. Cleo Wilkerson, Mrs Eunice Moore (teacher), Thomas Southern, Frank Hayworth, A.L. Wilkerson, Jessie Southern, Marie Hayworth, Drucilla Hayworth, Peggy Reasonover, Lulu Wilkerson, Samuel Wilkerson, David Wilkerson, John Alec Southern. Identified by Marie Hayworth Hill of Eagle River, Alaska.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:source: Looking Back at Tennessee Photograph Collection, 1890-1981
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Schools; Educational facilities; Buildings; Teachers; Children; Students
